headline: US-Iran nuclear talks begin in Oman; Islamabad mosque bombing kills 31; Winter Olympics open in Milan-Cortina; Russian GRU general shot in Moscow

categories.title: Global Events
categories.summary:
The United States and Iran kicked off high-stakes nuclear talks in Oman today, mediated by Omani officials, with deep disagreements over expanding the agenda to include Tehran's missiles. Trump warned he has military options. Separately, at least 31 people were killed and 169+ wounded in a suicide bombing at a Shiite mosque in Islamabad during Friday prayers â€” one of the deadliest attacks in Pakistan's capital in years. ([Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/iran-us-negotiate-oman-amid-deep-rifts-mounting-war-fears-2026-02-06/), [Al Jazeera](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2026/2/6/explosion-rocks-mosque-in-pakistans-islamabad))
Russian GRU Lt. Gen. Vladimir Alexeyev was shot multiple times in Moscow in an apparent assassination attempt. Musk shut down Starlink terminals across the Ukrainian front line after Kyiv's request, cutting Russian forces' internet. Canada and France opened Greenland consulates pushing back on Trump's demands. Tonight: the 2026 Winter Olympics open in Milan-Cortina at San Siro. ([BBC](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c3686nzexp3o), [Kyiv Post](https://www.kyivpost.com/post/69509), [NBC Olympics](https://www.nbcolympics.com/news/how-watch-opening-ceremony-2026-milan-cortina-olympics-tv-and-stream-schedule))
